content.en: Iron bioavailability algorithms: Computer algorithms are being used to study the effect of dietary factors on iron bioavailability in various populations, such as Russian women and children, rural Mexican communities, Bangladeshi women, Moroccan children, and adults in the United States. These algorithms are developed to estimate iron sufficiency, absorption, and balance, as well as to predict the effects of fortification and dietary modifications. However, the accuracy of current algorithms for iron and zinc bioavailability may need improvement. Overall, these algorithms provide valuable insights into the impact of dietary iron on human health.
content.da: Algoritmer for biotilgængelighed af jern: Computeralgoritmer bruges til at undersøge effekten af ​​diætfaktorer på jernbiotilgængelighed i forskellige populationer, såsom russiske kvinder og børn, landlige mexicanske samfund, bangladeshiske kvinder, marokkanske børn og voksne i USA. Disse algoritmer er udviklet til at estimere jernforsyning, absorption og balance samt til at forudsige virkningerne af berigelse og diætændringer. Dog kan nøjagtigheden af ​​de nuværende algoritmer for jern- og zinkbiotilgængelighed have behov for forbedring. Samlet set giver disse algoritmer værdifuld indsigt i diætjernets indvirkning på menneskers sundhed.
